title: US Justice Department says Donald Trump can be sued over role in January 6 riot
description: The Justice Department refuted Trump's claims of presidential immunity, saying that he can be sued for acts judged clearly outside of his official duties

title: US, Russia hold highest-level talks since Ukraine invasion
description: Blinken said he told Lavrov that the US would continue to support Ukraine for as long as it takes and would push for the war to end through diplomatic terms that Kyiv agrees to.

title: Biden to host EU chief von der Leyen on March 10
Why conspiracy theorists, the Kremlin echo each other's disinformation
description: Since the beginning of the war in Ukraine, Western conspiracy theorists and the Kremlin have each spread similar disinformation online.

title: Wayne Shorter, esoteric jazz elder, dies at 89
description: The enigmatic jazz elder performed with fellow legend Miles Davis and went on to become a leading bandleader on both soprano and tenor sax, including with his group Weather Report.

title: French Sénat awaits 'clarifications' on pension reform
description: Senators are to examine a controversial pension reform proposed by the government from Thursday up to March 12. The bill did not reach the voting stage at the Assemblée Nationale.

title: Erdogan maintains Turkish election schedule despite earthquake devastation
description: The Turkish president responded to criticism of his government's action following the natural disaster by promising an 'appropriate response on May 14,' the date of the presidential and legislative elections.

title: 'Detention centers have become places where human rights are systematically violated and dignity seriously undermined'
description: Fanélie Carrey-Conte, the secretary general of French NGO La Cimade, vehemently criticizes the detention conditions of foreigners under threat of expulsion in France, who face violence and solitary confinement.

title: In a Turkish city spared by the earthquake, the mayor faces criticism
description: Erzin was not damaged by the February 6 earthquake that killed more than 50,000 people. But its young mayor Ökkeş Elmasoğlu has come under fire since he boasted of his strict enforcement of city planning rules, pointing out the failings of the ruling AKP in the process.

title: TikTok: 'China's soft power flagship is in the crosshairs of the US, Canada and Europe'
description: The sudden crackdown against the popular Chinese social media app comes from two major fears, on privacy for the Europeans and Chinese control for the US.

title: In response to Macron's Africa speech: 'Walking the walk, that's what Africans expect'
description: Fahiraman Rodrigue Koné, a researcher at the Institute for Security Studies in Dakar, describes the inconsistencies and paradoxes of France's strategy in Africa.

title: Russia reports Ukraine 'sabotage' attack on its territory
description: Russian media released contradictory reports about a Ukrainian 'saboteur' group’s alleged breakthrough in southern Russia.

title: Germany's Scholz demanded China refrain from sending weapons to Russia
description: Scholz's remarks underscored how the international response to the war in Ukraine highlighted global divisions, as China and India have stopped short from condemning the Russian invasion or joining the West in imposing sanctions.

title: Concern mounts for Mortaza Behboudi, a French-Afghan journalist detained by the Taliban
description: Mortaza Behboudi was arrested when he returned to Kabul in January to write a report. His name was on a Taliban blacklist of undesirables, which includes journalists.

title: Greece's obsolete rail network blamed after deadly crash
description: An investigation was underway to find out the origins of the train collision that killed at least 42 on Tuesday.

title: Ozempic: French authorities issue alert for anti-diabetic drug misused for weight loss
description: On March 1, the French National Agency for Drug Safety and French Health Insurance announced 'enhanced surveillance' for this drug, which is subject to supply difficulties.

title: Matt Hancock denies leaked messages reveal ex-health minister ignored Covid-19 advice
description: The WhatsApp messages show the former health secretary  overruled scientific advice to test everyone going in to nursing homes.

title: ‘Havana syndrome’ not linked to foreign adversary: US intelligence
description: The involvement of overseas enemies in ‘anomalous health incidents’ suffered by US diplomats and spies was considered to be ‘very unlikely.’

title: India PM Modi calls for unity on global issues at G20 dominated by Ukraine
description: India, which holds the G20 presidency  this year, has declined to blame Russia for the war and has sought a diplomatic solution.

title: Panama's Supreme Court rules against same-sex marriages
description: In its ruling, the court said that 'no matter how many changes happen in reality,' gay marriages lack 'conventional and constitutional recognition.'

title: Prince Harry and Meghan asked to leave their UK home
description: The bid to move Harry and Meghan out of Frogmore Cottage was reportedly greenlit by his father, King Charles.

title: Paris 2024 Olympics: Random draw frustration leads to giving up buying expensive tickets
description: The first phase of ticket sales is drawing criticism for high prices and unavailable events, leading to confusion and frustration among potential attendees.

title: A downtrodden Bolsonaro ponders his next moves in Florida
description: The ex-Brazilian president didn't deal well with his defeat and the chaos surrounding his reign's end. It's unclear if he will emerge stronger from his American exile.

title: Fespaco 2023: A film festival of resistance in Burkina Faso
description: Despite political instability and terrorist threats, the Panafrican Film and Television Festival of Ouagadougou opened on February 25, providing a cultural interlude to a capital deserted by visitors.

title: US Congress votes against ESG investing, setting up Biden to issue his first veto
description: On Wednesday, the US Senate voted to block pension funds from consider taking environmental, social and governance (ESG) factors into their investment decision.

title: In Beijing, Belarusian leader Alexander Lukashenko approves Chinese plan to resolve the 'Ukrainian crisis'
description: The West sees the meeting of the Belarusian leader, an ally of Moscow, with Xi Jinping as a new sign of support for Russia.

title: Nigerian President-elect Bola Tinubu promises to be 'a fair leader' to a 'disillusioned' Nigeria
description: Only 25 million votes were cast out of 93 million registered voters, a 27% turnout. This is a drop in the bucket compared to the 216 million people living in Africa’s most populous country.

title: New York will pay demonstrators who were 'kettled' by police officers during 2020 racial justice protests
description: The city has agreed to pay 300 people $21,500 to settle a lawsuit that accused New York police of a 'brutal response' to the demonstrations that followed the murder of George Floyd.

title: In Belgium, the state of the prisons is becoming a 'national catastrophe'
description: Overcrowding, dilapidated buildings, lack of health services, lack of personnel: the situation of the detainees is getting worse, despite damning reports.
